info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 9:24PM EDT until April 22 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...
Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continue.
* WHERE...Sturgeon River near Alston.
* WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Homes and structures along the low lying areas and numerous roads become impacted by flood water. In Houghton County...Sturgeon River Road...Aho Road...and Rajala Road are impacted. In Baraga County...Sturgeon Road...Halonen Road and Usitalo Road are impacted. Along Froberg Road...Tahtinen Road... Irwin Road...Oliver Road...and Shirley Road are impacted.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.9 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at noon EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
